esqlQuery.esql:
// Alert when PostgreSQL query mean latency exceeds 5 seconds within the look back time window.
// The alert is grouped by statement user_id, query_id and host name.
// You can adjust the threshold value by modifying the mean_query_time value in the WHERE clause, which is specified in milliseconds.
FROM metrics-postgresql.statement-default
| KEEP postgresql.statement.query.time.mean.ms, host.name, postgresql.statement.user.id, postgresql.statement.query.id, @timestamp
| WHERE postgresql.statement.query.id IS NOT NULL
| STATS mean_query_time = MAX(postgresql.statement.query.time.mean.ms) BY host.name, postgresql.statement.user.id, postgresql.statement.query.id
| WHERE mean_query_time >= 5000
| EVAL mean_query_time = ROUND(mean_query_time, 2)
| SORT mean_query_time DESC
| LIMIT 100
